summary:
I have honed my marketing and program management expertise within the AgeTech industry throughout my career. By utilizing a data-driven approach to inform decision-making and optimize outcomes, I successfully guide companies to achieve their goals and make a lasting impact within the senior care landscape.

My mission is to connect and increase visibility for organizations dedicated to enriching opportunities for senior living and senior care.  My work enables families to make informed choices for their loved ones, allowing my clients to guide and expand their overall industry impact and revenue opportunities. 

With a keen eye for detail and a dedication to excellence, I thrive overseeing projects where I can make a difference. I excel at uncovering insights, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing creative strategies to enhance program effectiveness. 

Accomplishments include:
• 2 multi-million dollar startup acquisitions where I was on the leadership team
• Recognizing $100K in revenues by producing the first annual UC Berkeley Aging & Research Technology Summit
• Running Apple & Google partnerships for AgeTech companies, overseeing an almost $500k budget for the projects
• Leading relationships with Great Placed to Work for Aging Services and U.S. News & World Report Best Senior Living
• Developed and launched Catalyst, a Well-Being Lifestyle Program for Juniper Senior Living
• Grew Aging2.0 from 1 person to 15, and hosted over 100 events including 1000+ person conferences

As a consultant, I have had the privilege of collaborating with a diverse range of clients, including renowned senior care providers, research institutions, tech companies and industry leaders. I guide my clients toward success through strategic consulting by providing actionable recommendations, facilitating partnerships, and driving measurable results.

I’d love to connect to explore how I can make a difference for your organization. 

More about me:
• A founding member of Aging2.0
• Started a consulting firm early in my career 
• Board Member for the San Francisco Villages
• Advisory Board Member for the University of Leeds in the UK
• A Master's in Biomolecular Engineering and Bioinformatics, where I published and patented my research

currentPositions.description:
Play a key role in driving product development and delivering exceptional solutions to our clients.
Focused on applying agile methodologies to our product integration cycle while increasing strategic partnerships. Key member of the integration team from the acquisition of Activated Insights. 

-	Successfully developed requirements for new key features and products, utilizing agile methodologies such as SCRUM to ensure efficient and effective product delivery.
-	Integration Management: As a member of the Integration Management Office, I have contributed to the successful integration of multiple products following our acquisition, consolidating offerings and enhancing overall value for our customers.
-	Strategic Partnerships: I have managed partnerships with industry leaders such as Great Place to Work and U.S. News and World Report, fostering valuable relationships and driving collaborative initiatives that enhance our market presence and client experience.
-	Data-Driven Analytics Expert: I specialize in supporting survey tools, critical products for Home Care Pulse. Our surveys, mandated at the federal level, provide vital information that contributes to the reputable insights published by U.S. News and World Report. I have also successfully launched core discharge surveys, created engaging marketing profiles for Great Place to Work, developed provider benchmarks, and provided reputation management training to our staff.
-	Thought Leader: I have been honored to share my expertise as a speaker at industry events, focusing on data-driven analytics and best practices in the senior care sector.
currentPositions.title: Senior Product Manager

fieldsOfStudy: Biomolecular Engineering Major and Bioinformatics Minor

patents.description:
NANOPIPETTE DEVICE AND METHOD FOR SUBCELLULAR ANALYSIS

Abstract: Described herein are devices and methods for extracting cellular material from living cells and then depositing them into to a receptacle in a nanoliter scale. Using a nanopipette integrated into a scanning ion conductance microscope (SICM), extraction of mitochondrial DNA from human BJ fibroblasts and Green Fluorescent Protein (GFP) transcripts from HeLa/GFP cells was achieved with minimal disruption to the cellular milieu and without chemical treatment prior to obtaining the isolated sample. Success of the extraction was confirmed by fluorescence microscopy and PCR analysis of the extracted material. The method and apparatus may be applied to many different cell types and intracellular targets, allowing not only single cell analysis, but single subcellular compartment analysis of materials extracted in their native state.
patents.title: Nanopipette Device and Method for Subcellular Analysis

publications.description:
Press:
Nature Nanotechnology, "Interrograting Single Cells" by Sarah Brown
http://www.nature.com.oca.ucsc.edu/nnano/reshigh/2014/0114/full/nnano.2013.307.html

Chemical & Engineering News, "Nanobiopsies On Living Cells" by Louisa Dalton
http://cen.acs.org/articles/91/web/2013/12/Nanobiopsies-Living-Cells.html

Nanowerk, "New technique allows robotic 'nanobiopsies' of living cells"
http://www.nanowerk.com/nanotechnology_news/newsid=33996.php#ixzz2r4Ek8dbU

Phys Org, "New technique allows "nanobiopsies" of living cells" by Tim Stephens
http://phys.org/news/2014-01-technique-nanobiopsies-cells.html

AllVoices, "Nanobiopsy technique can extract materials from cell without killing it"
http://www.allvoices.com/contributed-news/16371722-nanobiopsy-technique-can-extract-from-cell-without-killing-it

Abstract: 
The ability to study the molecular biology of living single cells in heterogeneous cell populations is essential for next generation analysis of cellular circuitry and function. Here, we developed a single-cell nanobiopsy platform based on scanning ion conductance microscopy (SICM) for continuous sampling of intracellular content from individual cells. The nanobiopsy platform uses electrowetting within a nanopipette to extract cellular material from living cells with minimal disruption of the cellular milieu. We demonstrate the subcellular resolution of the nanobiopsy platform by isolating small subpopulations of mitochondria from single living cells, and quantify mutant mitochondrial genomes in those single cells with high throughput sequencing technology. These findings may provide the foundation for dynamic subcellular genomic analysis.
publications.name: Compartmental Genomics in Single Living Cells

publications.description: Manipulation and analysis of single cells is the next frontier in understanding processes that control the function and fate of cells. Herein we describe a single-cell injection platform based on nanopipettes. The system uses scanning microscopy techniques to detect cell surfaces, and voltage pulses to deliver molecules into individual cells. As a proof of concept, we injected adherent mammalian cells with fluorescent dyes
publications.name: Voltage controlled nano-injection system for single-cell surgery
Single-cell manipulation using Nanopipettes
publications.description: Manipulation and analysis of individual cells is key in understanding processes that control single-cell behavior in complex environment. Nanotechnology-based tools having high sensitivity and low invasiveness are holding great promises as new biomedical devices for single cell manipulation. The fully electrical read-out as well as the ease and low cost of fabrication are unique features that give nanopipette technology enormous potential. Our group has used nanopipettes as a biosensor, and is now continuing to use nanopipettes for single-cell manipulation. We developed a single-cell manipulation platform based on quartz nanopipettes. The system uses scanning microscopy techniques to position the nanopipette with nanoscale precision. The nanopipette is fitted with electrodes to mediate voltage-dependent injection or aspiration form individual cells. This technology can be used for stem cell research by injection of a customized cocktail of molecules to induce pluripotency.

publications.name: Why a glass-sided toaster could help the elderly live at home for longer

message.text: It was great to be part of the event and engage with people driving innovation in the life sciences ecosystem 🙌

Feeling inspired from our day in Leiden! 🇳🇱 There’s nothing more energizing than connecting with the scientists and technologists driving R&D innovation. 
Thank you to everyone who joined, especially our speakers Aga Wegrzyn (EV Biotech), Elsa Lauwers (Paleo), Henning Redestig (IFF), and Tobias Wingbermühle (Clustermarket), who shared their insights on the impact of #digitaltransformation.

Did you miss the event? Get notified about future events, by signing up for our newsletter 👉 https://lnkd.in/efYjVdqC
